Articles.Content:
It's actually more of proof-of-concept - it's quite useless since it barely makes it to the orbit on the fuel it has - but it can be used as a base for somewhat larger SSTO - kerbed, with science or fulfilling role of contract satellite, and the "big brother" version makes it to the orbit with some 1500m/s of dV with a pilot. But making the larger versions is left as exercise to the reader, they are fairly trivial too.

Anyway, the craft makes rather heavy use of clipping to hide its nuke and keep the wheels level. And I gave up on landing, the parachute is enough to bring it safely to the surface, just don't splash down and add one more parachute to a bigger version.

Anyway, here it is: MSSTO

Flight profile:

Take off at 100m/s, hide the wheels, climb nearly vertically to 10,000, level down to some 20-30 degrees and keep going until your speed stops rising. Then fire the nuke and level down to some 10 degrees. Keep burning until you get the desired apoapsis, it takes a long while and even then needs some corrective burns before you escape the atmosphere.

On descent keep your nose 20-30 degrees up and engines off, there's no other philosophy to it. Parachute below 250m/s, over a relatively level terrain.

And here's the aforementioned big brother.

Clever design! Quite different from what I've seen before.
